intro: Tibouchina lindeniana, commonly known as the pink trumpet bush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tibouchina lindeniana thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
